instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the research on developing a inversion model of soil moisture content in alpine meadows?

instruction: What metric was chosen to verify the inversion accuracy of the hyperspectral inversion model of soil moisture content in alpine meadows and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to verify the inversion accuracy of the hyperspectral inversion model of soil moisture content in alpine meadows is the coefficient of determination (R-2), root mean square error (RMSE), and the residual ratio of prediction (RPD). instruction: What machine learning models were used in the research on developing a hyperspectral inversion model of soil moisture content in alpine meadows in the Yellow River source area?

instruction: Can the spectral reflectance in the visible-near infrared band be considered superior to traditional methods for developing a hyperspectral inversion model of soil moisture content in alpine meadows in the Yellow River source area?

This information suggests that the spectral reflectance in the visible-near infrared band can provide valuable data for accurately estimating soil moisture content. Additionally, the text mentions that the back propagation neural network (BPNN) model corresponding to the spectral reflectance in this band achieved high accuracy in the inversion of soil moisture content.
